remarks: The isomorphism H of an atom is a 1-dim subspace.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Apr-2014.)
statement:
dihatlat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
dihatlat.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dihatlat.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihatlat.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihatlat.l $e |- L = ( LSAtoms ` U ) $.
dihatlat $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ Q e. A ) -> ( I ` Q ) e. L ) $.
